name: obsidian-plugin
description: A comprehensive toolkit that transforms educational content into intelligent, searchable knowledge bases. It processes PDFs, extracts annotations, generates AI-powered summaries from videos (with transcripts) and questions/answers, creates hierarchical course structures, and seamlessly integrates with popular tools like Obsidian and Anki for enhanced learning workflows. See details at https://github.com/danielshue/notebook-automation

scripts.build: tsc -noEmit -skipLibCheck && node esbuild.config.mjs production && node -e "const fs = require('fs'); const path = require('path'); const distRoot = path.resolve('../../dist'); if (!fs.existsSync(distRoot)) fs.mkdirSync(distRoot, { recursive: true }); fs.copyFileSync('manifest.json', path.join(distRoot, 'manifest.json')); fs.copyFileSync('styles.css', path.join(distRoot, 'styles.css')); fs.copyFileSync('default-config.json', path.join(distRoot, 'default-config.json')); if (fs.existsSync('main.js')) fs.copyFileSync('main.js', path.join(distRoot, 'main.js')); try { const exes = fs.readdirSync('.').filter(f => f.startsWith('na-') && (f.endsWith('.exe') || (!f.includes('.') && f.includes('-')))); exes.forEach(exe => fs.copyFileSync(exe, path.join(distRoot, exe))); console.log('Copied ' + exes.length + ' executables'); } catch(e) { console.log('No executables found (this is normal for local development)'); }"
scripts.version: node version-bump.mjs && git add manifest.json versions.json
scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build

author: Dan Shue
